metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2477 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The CSN.1 dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.6 does not properlymanage function pointers, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (application crash) via a malformed packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2477` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark11 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap8 - 1.10.6-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil9 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
